criteria: Application of Emergency Plans at Home
Application of Emergency Plans at School
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of emergency, fire, and safety plans.
Student shows minimal awareness of emergency plans but cannot describe them accurately.
Student can identify some elements of emergency plans but lacks detail and clarity.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of emergency plans, including key steps and procedures.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of emergency plans and can explain their importance.
Student demonstrates an exceptional understanding of emergency plans and can articulate their implementation in various scenarios.
Student does not apply or discuss emergency plans at home.
Student mentions the existence of emergency plans at home but does not actively participate in them.
Student occasionally participates in emergency plan drills at home but lacks consistency.
Student regularly participates in emergency plan drills at home and understands their role.
Student actively applies emergency plans at home and can explain their importance to family members.
Student takes a leadership role in implementing and improving emergency plans at home, ensuring preparedness.
Student does not apply or discuss emergency plans at school.
Student is vaguely aware of emergency plans at school but does not actively participate.
Student sometimes participates in emergency drills at school but lacks engagement.
Student consistently participates in emergency drills at school and follows instructions.
Student actively applies emergency plans at school and helps others during drills.
Student demonstrates leadership in emergency drills at school, ensuring the safety and preparedness of peers.
Student shows no knowledge of safety procedures.
Student has minimal awareness of safety procedures but cannot describe them accurately.
Student can identify some safety procedures but lacks detail and clarity.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of safety procedures.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of safety procedures and their importance.
Student demonstrates an exceptional understanding of safety procedures and can articulate their implementation in various scenarios.
